title: 111_s1520
content: CHAPTER 1504 - NATIONAL AMERICAN INDIAN VETERANS, INCORPORATED: This section recognizes National American Indian Veterans, Incorporated as a corporation and grants them a federal charter under Part B of subtitle II of title 36, United States Code. The National American Indian Veterans, Incorporated is a federally chartered nonprofit corporation in the United States. It has specific purposes, a board of directors, officers, and various powers and restrictions outlined in the chapter. The National American Indian Veterans, Incorporated is a federally chartered nonprofit corporation in the United States with specific purposes outlined in its articles of incorporation, constitution, and bylaws. These purposes include upholding and defending the Constitution of the United States while respecting the sovereignty of American Indian, Alaska Native, and Native Hawaiian Nations. The National American Indian Veterans, Incorporated aims to unite American Indian, Alaska Native, and Native Hawaiian veterans, advocate for their rights regardless of service period, and promote social welfare. The National American Indian Veterans, Incorporated aims to promote social welfare and advocate for the needs of American Indian, Alaska Native, and Native Hawaiian veterans, regardless of their service period. The National American Indian Veterans, Incorporated advocates for the needs of American Indian, Alaska Native, and Native Hawaiian veterans, promotes research on their relationship with American society, and provides technical assistance to regions without veterans committees. Sec. 150403 outlines the eligibility for membership in the corporation, as well as the rights and privileges of members as provided in the constitution and by-laws. Sec. 150404 discusses the board of directors. "Sec. 150405 details the officers of the corporation and their election process, as outlined in the constitution and bylaws." The officers of the corporation and the election process are outlined in the constitution and bylaws, in conformity with the laws of the jurisdiction under which the corporation is incorporated. The corporation is prohibited from discriminating based on race, color, religion, sex, national origin, handicap, or age in membership conditions and requirements for serving on the board of directors or as an officer. The corporation must not discriminate based on race, color, religion, sex, national origin, handicap, or age when determining membership requirements, serving on the board of directors, or as an officer. The corporation's powers are limited to those granted in its articles of incorporation and bylaws, conforming to the jurisdiction's laws. The corporation has the exclusive right to use the name 'National American Indian Veterans' and related symbols. The corporation has the exclusive right to use the names 'National American Indian Veterans, Incorporated' and 'National American Indian Veterans', as well as related seals, emblems, and badges. It is restricted from issuing stock, paying dividends, or distributing income or assets. The corporation named 'National American Indian Veterans, Incorporated' is restricted from issuing stock, paying dividends, or distributing income or assets to members, officers, or directors during the charter's lifespan. However, reasonable compensation and expenses can be approved by the board of directors. The corporation is prohibited from making loans to its officers, directors, members, or employees and cannot claim congressional approval for its activities. It must also maintain its tax-exempt status as an organization. The corporation must maintain its tax-exempt status as an organization and keep correct and complete records of accounts and minutes of proceedings involving members, directors, or committees. The corporation must maintain correct and complete books and records of accounts, minutes of proceedings involving members, directors, or committees, and a record of member names and addresses for voting purposes. All books and records can be inspected by members or their agents for any proper purpose at any reasonable time. The corporation's books and records can be inspected by members or their agents for any proper purpose at any reasonable time. This does not override the laws of the jurisdiction where the corporation is incorporated or operates. The corporation must comply with the laws of the jurisdiction regarding service of process. The corporation must comply with the laws of the jurisdiction regarding service of process and liability for acts of officers and agents within the United States and its territories. The corporation is liable for the acts of its officers and agents when they act within their authority. Failure to comply with requirements may result in the expiration of the charter. The corporation must report annually to Congress on its activities. The corporation must report annually to Congress on its activities, and failure to comply may result in the expiration of the charter. The annual report is not made public. No annual report under this section shall be printed as a public document. "1504. National American Indian Veterans, Incorporated..... 150401"
